summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by a U.S. Magistrate Judge authorizing the forensic review of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's person, his New York residence, and his private island, Little Saint James. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy, specifically targeting communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs involving Epstein, co-conspirators, and victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation. Devices were seized from his person upon arrest and from his residences in New York and the Virgin Islands. The warrant seeks evidence of his violations of federal sex trafficking laws.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses of sex trafficking, transportation of minors, and enticement.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and device seizure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI, and two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York residence
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private residence in New York, NY, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James island
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James in the U.S. Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Warrant issued for device review
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued the search and seizure warrant authorizing forensic review of the 62 seized devices for evidence of federal crimes.

locations: New York, NY (Epstein's private residence, address redacted)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein in three separate actions: 2 from his person upon arrest (July 6, 2019), 33 from his New York residence (July 11, 2019), and 27 from his private island, Little Saint James (August 12, 2019).
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein, and the search seeks evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

The search targets evidence of violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), enticement to travel (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371) for the period from 1994 through August 8, 2019.

Specific items sought include communications among co-conspirators, financial records of payments to victims/co-conspirators, travel documents for victims, and nude or sexually suggestive photographs of individuals who appear to be teenage girls or younger.
The document notes that at least one name of an alleged co-conspirator is redacted in the warrant text, appearing as blank spaces alongside Ghislaine Maxwell's name.
